channel.title: cabbage on Offline Cook Book
channel.description: Recent content in cabbage on Offline Cook Book

item.title: Coleslaw
item.description: This is a coleslaw recipe that I got from a chili restaurant in my neighborhood that closed down a few years ago. This recipe makes more dressing than needed for the coleslaw, so you can save it or use it as a vegetable dip. ‚è≤Ô∏è Prep time: 25 min ü•∂ Fridge time: 1 hr üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 8 - 10 Ingredients 3/4 cup mayonnaise 1/2 cup buttermilk 3 tbsp lemon juice 3 tbsp apple cider vinegar 4 tbsp distilled vinegar 1/3 cup olive oil 1/4 cup granulated sugar 1 1/2 tsp kosher salt 1 tsp ground black pepper 1 tsp celery seeds 1/2 tsp onion powder 1/4 tsp granulated garlic 1/4 tsp mustard powder One large head of green cabbage One large carrot Directions Finely shred, rinse, and drain the carrot Finely shred the cabbage (use a food processor if possible) Whisk together the mayonnaise, buttermilk, lemon juice, cider vinegar, distilled vinegar, olive oil, and sugar Add the salt, pepper, celery seeds, onion powder, and granulated garlic, and combine well Combine the shredded cabbage and carrot in a separate bowl Slowly add the dressing until it lightly coats the vegetables, and toss well.

item.title: Egg Roll in a Bowl
item.description: Egg rolls, but, you know, in a bowl. ‚è≤Ô∏è Prep time: 10 min üç≥ Cook time: 15 min üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 2 Ingredients 1 pound ground turkey 1 bag coleslaw mix 1 small onion 2-3 cloves of garlic 1 tbsp fresh ginger 1/4 cup Hoisin sauce soy sauce sesame oil Directions Grate or mince ginger finely. Process with the garlic cloves by grinding with salt under the edge of a knife.

item.title: Sauerkraut
item.description: Sauerkraut is a based lacto-fermented food that is healthy and has a long shelf live. Ingredients 1 head of cabbage 2-4% sea salt by cabbage weight Directions Prepare and clean as many glass jars as you think you’ll need. Chop or shred cabbage and rinse under cold water. Sprinkle with salt. Knead the cabbage with clean hands for about 10 minutes until there is enough liquid to cover it.
